title: Can you legally shoulder an AR 15 pistol with a stabilizing brace on it? - Quora
tags: Gun Control in the United States of America

response.answer_text: Before we begin: I am not a lawyer, I’m not your lawyer, I’m not a paralegal, I don’t even like you, and none of this should be regarded as legal advice. Now that’s covered the answer is… “Probably”. The main factor in determining whether or not you’re legally able to shoulder it is if you’ve installed it on the weapon according to the directions, and have not altered it in any way. The ATF is VERY touchy about what constitutes a redesign. If you change anything, they will have a much easier time saying that you “redesigned” it counter to its original purpose, and did so in order to make it a shoulder stock. The first three links included all seem to imply that it’s legal to shoulder an unaltered brace. The last link makes me uncertain because it’s more recent. Yes, the jury let the guy off, but the point is that they still charged him for it, well after the other three links would have you believe that it’s fine. So, I would say that if you do get one, and do want to occasionally shoot it from the shoulder it will probably be fine as long as you use a bone stock model with no changes. In other words; to not be a stock, it has to be stock. YES, It Is Legal to Shoulder an AR-15 Pistol Equipped with an Arm Brace - The Truth About Guns https://cdn0.thetruthaboutguns.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Barnes-Stabilizing-Brace-Letter-Final-3.21.17.pdf ATF letter on the subject. https://cdn0.thetruthaboutguns.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Barnes-Stabilizing-Brace-Letter-Final-3.21.17.pdf ATF Prosecutes Ohio Man for AR Pistol with Brace

Yes, but realize this is a moving target with the ATF. From reading the ATF’s recent letter, you can shoulder the brace, but if you put a forward grip on it, that turns it into an NFA weapon and then must be registered as an SBR. Something about turning it from a one handed operation to a 2 handed operation. To play it safe, I took my forward “Tango Down” grip off my AR pistol. Read the recent ATF letter and if you still have legal questions, contact an attorney that specializes in 2A law. Don’t rely on Quora for legal advice!!!!
https://cdn0.thetruthaboutguns.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Barnes-Stabilizing-Brace-Letter-Final-3.21.17.pdf The BATFE issued a statement on this topic two years ago. The answer is yes.
That depends on which way the wind is blowing at the ATF! Though it has flipped on occasion as of this day ironically April fools day yes you can..
Short answer: yes. Source: The ATF’s tech branch. Google your question, you should be able to find their re-re-interpretation that stopped outlawing it.
